input.question_text: Times there has been a declaration of a public health emergency of international concern by the World Health Organization

output.question_text: Times there has been a declaration of a public health emergency of international concern by the World Health Organization

niche_list_items.description: The H1N1 influenza pandemic, also known as the swine flu, was declared a Public Health Emergency of International Concern in 2009 due to the rapid spread of the virus and the impact on global health.

criteria_assessments.description: Verify that the World Health Organization officially declared the event as a Public Health Emergency of International Concern (PHEIC).
criteria_assessments.validity_assessment: The 2009 H1N1 Influenza Pandemic was indeed declared a Public Health Emergency of International Concern by the WHO.

criteria_assessments.description: Ensure that the declaration date aligns with the official WHO announcement date for the PHEIC.
criteria_assessments.validity_assessment: The PHEIC for H1N1 was declared on April 25, 2009, aligning with the WHO announcement.

criteria_assessments.description: Confirm that the health event had significant international implications, justifying the PHEIC status.
criteria_assessments.validity_assessment: The H1N1 pandemic had significant international implications, affecting multiple countries and resulting in an estimated 100,000-400,000 deaths globally in the first year.

criteria_assessments.description: Check that the declaration led to specific international public health response measures coordinated by WHO.
criteria_assessments.validity_assessment: The declaration of H1N1 as a PHEIC led to the development of a pandemic vaccine and international health measures coordinated by WHO.

criteria_assessments.description: Determine whether the PHEIC status was eventually lifted and verify the date and conditions under which it was resolved.
criteria_assessments.validity_assessment: There is insufficient information in the provided results to determine when the PHEIC status for the 2009 H1N1 Pandemic was lifted.

niche_list_items.type_description: Times there has been a declaration of a public health emergency of international concern by the World Health Organization

niche_list_items.description: In 2014, the resurgence of polio in several countries led to its declaration as a Public Health Emergency of International Concern to enhance coordinated international response efforts.

criteria_assessments.description: Verify that the World Health Organization officially declared the event as a Public Health Emergency of International Concern (PHEIC).
criteria_assessments.validity_assessment: The World Health Organization declared the international spread of wild poliovirus as a Public Health Emergency of International Concern (PHEIC) on 5 May 2014.

criteria_assessments.description: Ensure that the declaration date aligns with the official WHO announcement date for the PHEIC.
criteria_assessments.validity_assessment: The declaration date of 5 May 2014 aligns with the official WHO announcement for the PHEIC.

criteria_assessments.description: Confirm that the health event had significant international implications, justifying the PHEIC status.
criteria_assessments.validity_assessment: The spread of wild poliovirus in 2014 was considered an extraordinary event and a public health risk to other states, justifying the PHEIC status.

criteria_assessments.description: Check that the declaration led to specific international public health response measures coordinated by WHO.
criteria_assessments.validity_assessment: The declaration led to coordinated international responses, including vaccination requirements for travelers and sustained surveillance efforts.

criteria_assessments.description: Determine whether the PHEIC status was eventually lifted and verify the date and conditions under which it was resolved.
criteria_assessments.validity_assessment: There is no information provided on the resolution status or the lifting of the PHEIC status for the 2014 polio resurgence.

niche_list_items.type_description: Times there has been a declaration of a public health emergency of international concern by the World Health Organization

niche_list_items.description: The 2022 monkeypox outbreak was declared a Public Health Emergency of International Concern due to its spread across multiple countries and potential for further international spread.

criteria_assessments.description: Verify that the World Health Organization officially declared the event as a Public Health Emergency of International Concern (PHEIC).
criteria_assessments.validity_assessment: The WHO declared the multi-country outbreak of monkeypox as a Public Health Emergency of International Concern (PHEIC).

criteria_assessments.description: Ensure that the declaration date aligns with the official WHO announcement date for the PHEIC.
criteria_assessments.validity_assessment: The WHO announced the PHEIC on the outbreak of monkeypox on July 23, 2022.

criteria_assessments.description: Confirm that the health event had significant international implications, justifying the PHEIC status.
criteria_assessments.validity_assessment: The outbreak had significant international implications, with challenges in transmission patterns across different regions, justifying the PHEIC status.

criteria_assessments.description: Check that the declaration led to specific international public health response measures coordinated by WHO.
criteria_assessments.validity_assessment: Temporary Recommendations were issued to States Parties to manage and control the outbreak, indicating coordinated international response measures by WHO.

criteria_assessments.description: Determine whether the PHEIC status was eventually lifted and verify the date and conditions under which it was resolved.
criteria_assessments.validity_assessment: There is insufficient information in the provided sources to determine if and when the PHEIC status was lifted for the monkeypox outbreak.

niche_list_items.description: The Ebola outbreak in West Africa was declared a PHEIC in August 2014, highlighting the urgent need for international cooperation to control the disease's spread.

criteria_assessments.description: Verify that the World Health Organization officially declared the event as a Public Health Emergency of International Concern (PHEIC).
criteria_assessments.validity_assessment: The World Health Organization did declare the 2014 West Africa Ebola outbreak as a Public Health Emergency of International Concern.

criteria_assessments.description: Ensure that the declaration date aligns with the official WHO announcement date for the PHEIC.
criteria_assessments.validity_assessment: The declaration of the Ebola outbreak as a PHEIC was made in 2014, aligning with the timeline of the outbreak.

criteria_assessments.description: Confirm that the health event had significant international implications, justifying the PHEIC status.
criteria_assessments.validity_assessment: The Ebola outbreak had significant international implications, including widespread transmission and the need for international response.

criteria_assessments.description: Check that the declaration led to specific international public health response measures coordinated by WHO.
criteria_assessments.validity_assessment: The declaration led to coordinated international response measures, including recommendations for health care services and travel advisories.

criteria_assessments.description: Determine whether the PHEIC status was eventually lifted and verify the date and conditions under which it was resolved.
criteria_assessments.validity_assessment: There is insufficient information from the provided sources to determine when the PHEIC status was lifted.

niche_list_items.type_description: Times there has been a declaration of a public health emergency of international concern by the World Health Organization

niche_list_items.description: The WHO declared the Zika virus outbreak a PHEIC in February 2016 due to its association with birth defects and neurological disorders.

criteria_assessments.description: Verify that the World Health Organization officially declared the event as a Public Health Emergency of International Concern (PHEIC).
criteria_assessments.validity_assessment: The World Health Organization officially declared the 2016 Zika Virus Outbreak as a Public Health Emergency of International Concern.

criteria_assessments.description: Ensure that the declaration date aligns with the official WHO announcement date for the PHEIC.
criteria_assessments.validity_assessment: The declaration date of February 1, 2016, aligns with the WHO's official announcement for the PHEIC.

criteria_assessments.description: Confirm that the health event had significant international implications, justifying the PHEIC status.
criteria_assessments.validity_assessment: The Zika virus outbreak had significant international implications due to its spread and association with microcephaly and neurological disorders.

criteria_assessments.description: Check that the declaration led to specific international public health response measures coordinated by WHO.
criteria_assessments.validity_assessment: WHO coordinated international response measures including surveillance, mosquito control, and expedited development of diagnostic tests and vaccines.

criteria_assessments.description: Determine whether the PHEIC status was eventually lifted and verify the date and conditions under which it was resolved.
criteria_assessments.validity_assessment: The PHEIC status for the Zika virus outbreak was lifted on November 18, 2016, as part of the transition to longer-term response mechanisms.

niche_list_items.type_description: Times there has been a declaration of a public health emergency of international concern by the World Health Organization

niche_list_items.description: In July 2019, the WHO declared the Ebola outbreak in the Democratic Republic of the Congo a PHEIC, following its prolonged spread and impact on international borders.

criteria_assessments.description: Verify that the World Health Organization officially declared the event as a Public Health Emergency of International Concern (PHEIC).
criteria_assessments.validity_assessment: The WHO did declare the 2018-2020 Kivu Ebola Epidemic as a Public Health Emergency of International Concern.

criteria_assessments.description: Ensure that the declaration date aligns with the official WHO announcement date for the PHEIC.
criteria_assessments.validity_assessment: The WHO declared the Kivu Ebola epidemic a PHEIC on July 17, 2019, which aligns with the event dates.

criteria_assessments.description: Confirm that the health event had significant international implications, justifying the PHEIC status.
criteria_assessments.validity_assessment: The Kivu Ebola epidemic had significant international implications due to the potential for cross-border spread and the high mortality rate.

criteria_assessments.description: Check that the declaration led to specific international public health response measures coordinated by WHO.
criteria_assessments.validity_assessment: The PHEIC declaration led to international public health response measures coordinated by WHO and international partners.

criteria_assessments.description: Determine whether the PHEIC status was eventually lifted and verify the date and conditions under which it was resolved.
criteria_assessments.validity_assessment: The PHEIC status for the Kivu Ebola epidemic was lifted on June 26, 2020, following a decline in cases.

niche_list_items.type_description: Times there has been a declaration of a public health emergency of international concern by the World Health Organization

niche_list_items.description: On January 30, 2020, the WHO declared the outbreak a Public Health Emergency of International Concern (PHEIC) due to the novel coronavirus, and later declared it a pandemic on March 11, 2020.

criteria_assessments.description: Verify that the World Health Organization officially declared the event as a Public Health Emergency of International Concern (PHEIC).
criteria_assessments.validity_assessment: The World Health Organization officially declared COVID-19 a Public Health Emergency of International Concern (PHEIC) on January 30, 2020.

criteria_assessments.description: Ensure that the declaration date aligns with the official WHO announcement date for the PHEIC.
criteria_assessments.validity_assessment: The declaration date aligns with the official WHO announcement date for the COVID-19 PHEIC, which was January 30, 2020.

criteria_assessments.description: Confirm that the health event had significant international implications, justifying the PHEIC status.
criteria_assessments.validity_assessment: COVID-19 had significant international implications, including widespread transmission and impact on global health, justifying the PHEIC status.

criteria_assessments.description: Check that the declaration led to specific international public health response measures coordinated by WHO.
criteria_assessments.validity_assessment: The declaration of COVID-19 as a PHEIC led to coordinated international public health response measures, including increased surveillance and containment strategies.

criteria_assessments.description: Determine whether the PHEIC status was eventually lifted and verify the date and conditions under which it was resolved.
criteria_assessments.validity_assessment: The PHEIC status for COVID-19 was eventually lifted in May 2023.
